intro: Schizocarpum guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan schizocarp, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in complex, branched clusters. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two parts when mature, a unique feature of the genus. Schizocarpum guatemalense is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
